description: The function 'generate_single_angle_type' creates a visual representation of a single angle using rays. It is designed to aid in the understanding of angles in geometry, particularly their measurement and representation. The function draws two rays with a common vertex, and marks the angle between them, with special notation for right angles.

educational_standards.description: Determine if an angle is greater than, equal to, or less than a right angle.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Single Angle Visualization
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'generate_single_angle_type' function can draw a visual representation of a single angle. It accepts a single input, an instance of the SingleAngle class, which contains the measure of the angle in degrees. The function draws two rays with a common vertex, representing the angle, and marks the angle between them. If the angle is a right angle (90 degrees), it is marked with a square; otherwise, it is marked with an arc. This function is useful in teaching and learning about angles, their measurements, and their visual representations.

details: single_angle: An instance of the SingleAngle class, which contains the measure of the angle in degrees.
The single_angle input controls the angle that is drawn between the two rays.
The angle measure must be a valid number, typically between 0 and 360 degrees, inclusive.
The function validates the input by checking that it is an instance of the SingleAngle class.
The function draws two rays with a common vertex, representing the angle.
The angle between the rays is marked with an arc, or a square if it is a right angle.
The size and orientation of the angle are controlled by the single_angle input.
